intro: Senecio guantivanus, commonly known as the Guantiva Senecio, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in cool and temperate climates. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while its flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in dense clusters. Senecio guantivanus is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its unique appearance.
